semantic_title: Coding Both Current Burns and Sequelae When Both Conditions Exist Simultaneously
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 19. Injury, Poisoning, and Certain Other Consequences of External Causes > d. Burns and Corrosions > 8. Sequelae with a late effect code and current burn

content.full_text: When appropriate, both a code for a current burn or corrosion with 7th character "A" or "D" and a burn or corrosion code with 7th character "S" may be assigned on the same record (when both a current burn and sequelae of an old burn exist). Burns and corrosions do not heal at the same rate and a current healing wound may still exist with sequela of a healed burn or corrosion. See Section I.B.10. Sequela (Late Effects) (Evidence: pg no: 82, L26-L29)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding situations where a patient has both current burns/corrosions and sequelae from previous burns/corrosions, allowing both acute and sequela codes on the same record (Evidence: pg no: 82, L26-L29)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Both current burn codes (7th character A or D) and sequela codes (7th character S) may be assigned on the same record when both conditions exist (Evidence: pg no: 82, L26-L28)
detailed_rules.explanation: Burns and corrosions heal at different rates, so a patient may have a current healing wound alongside sequelae from a previously healed burn or corrosion (Evidence: pg no: 82, L28-L29)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Burns and corrosions do not heal at the same rate and current healing wounds may coexist with sequelae (Evidence: pg no: 82, L28-L29)
detailed_rules.explanation: This physiological reality supports the coding practice of using both acute and sequela codes when clinically appropriate (Evidence: pg no: 82, L28-L29)

Step 2: Determine which are current (healing) vs sequelae
Step 3: Assign appropriate codes with 7th character A/D for current
Step 4: Assign appropriate codes with 7th character S for sequelae
Step 5: Verify both types of conditions are documented
